constructionist noun [C]
(SOCIAL THEORY)
social science
  specialized someone who believes in social constructionism (= the idea that beliefs are formed by the habits and traditions of a society): Social constructionists think that science does not reveal any truths about the real world. She became involved in a heated debate between realists and constructionists.
